oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Randomized Clinical Field Trial of the Effect of Preweaning Viral Vaccination on the Incidence of Respiratory Disease in Dairy Heifer Calves Up to Four Months of Age
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Windeyer, C.
LeBlanc, S. J.
Lissemore, K. D.
Hodgins, D. C.
Godden, S. M.
Leslie, K. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bovine respiratory disease
BRD
modified-live viral vaccine
vaccine
dosage
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bovine respiratory disease (BRD) is an important illness of dairy replacement heifer calves that has substantial impacts on growth, survival and profitability. The objective of this research was to determine the effects of one or two doses of a commercial, multivalent,  (MLV) vaccine, administered to heifer calves prior to weaning. It was hypothesized that vaccination would reduce the incidence of BRD and that two doses would be more efficacious than one.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2010; 211-212
